<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Runescarred Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=912) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [World Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=6) pg. 119 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Runescarred](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=21)

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2)

**Access**
You are from the Saga Lands.

</column>

---

Whether through blood (if you’re Varisian, Shoanti, or New Thassilonian) or by exposure to rune magic, you have become runescarred, with visible, glowing runes on your body in the form of tattoos or scars. You might have possessed these marks before gaining the archetype, but you only truly became runescarred when you chose to study and tap into the runes’ power. You become an expert in [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) and you also become trained in Thassilon [Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8), or an expert in Thassilon Lore if you were already trained in it.

 Choose one cantrip from the [arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1) list. One of the runes on your body corresponds to the chosen cantrip, and you can cast the chosen cantrip as an innate arcane spell.

**Special** You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the runescarred archetype.

<title level="2">Runescarred Dedication leads to...</title>
[Living Rune](/Feats.aspx?ID=914), [Spell Runes](/Feats.aspx?ID=913), [Warding Rune](/Feats.aspx?ID=915)
